    public static class SVM.Trainer<T>
extends ClassifierTrainer<T>
    Trainer for support vector machines.

      • SVM.Trainer

        public SVM.Trainer(MercerKernel<T> kernel,
           double C)
        Constructor of trainer for binary SVMs.
        Parameters:
        kernel - the kernel function.
        C - the soft margin penalty parameter.

      • SVM.Trainer

        public SVM.Trainer(MercerKernel<T> kernel,
           double Cp,
           double Cn)
        Constructor of trainer for binary SVMs.
        Parameters:
        kernel - the kernel function.
        Cp - the soft margin penalty parameter for positive instances.
        Cn - the soft margin penalty parameter for negative instances.

      • SVM.Trainer

        public SVM.Trainer(MercerKernel<T> kernel,
           double C,
           int k,
           SVM.Multiclass strategy)
        Constructor of trainer for multi-class SVMs.
        Parameters:
        kernel - the kernel function.
        C - the soft margin penalty parameter.
        k - the number of classes.

      • SVM.Trainer

        public SVM.Trainer(MercerKernel<T> kernel,
           double C,
           double[] weight,
           SVM.Multiclass strategy)
        Constructor of trainer for multi-class SVMs.
        Parameters:
        kernel - the kernel function.
        C - the soft margin penalty parameter.
        weight - class weight. Must be positive. The soft margin penalty of class i will be weight[i] * C.

      • train

        public SVM<T> train(T[] x,
           int[] y)
        Description copied from class: ClassifierTrainer
        Learns a classifier with given training data.
        Specified by:
        train in class ClassifierTrainer<T>
        Parameters:
        x - the training instances.
        y - the training labels.
        Returns:
        a trained classifier.

      • train

        public SVM<T> train(T[] x,
           int[] y,
           double[] weight)
        Learns a SVM classifier with given training data.
        Parameters:
        x - training instances.
        y - training labels in [0, k), where k is the number of classes.
        weight - instance weight. Must be positive. The soft margin penalty for instance i will be weight[i] * C.
        Returns:
        trained SVM classifier
